ratings.comment: Subjective on objective topics and grades accordingly.

This class was a 1-credit seminar taught in Spring 2012 (and other semesters) for the Greenhouse Learning Community (then in Cole Hall). The course I took was "From Seed to Ground." Jack passionately shared with us the importance of connecting with the natural world and growing food, how to order seeds based on what we like to eat, and how to do it

He did a fine job for one of his last classes here at UW. Have taken courses with him before and he has been a character full of energy and excitement. Fair grader, honest about opinions and wants students to think for themselves. I'm glad to have taken this course and learned more from him.

Jack is very passionate about what he does and is a wonderful guy. He really wants his students to succeed and as long as you're willing to put in the effort you'll get a good grade. Very interesting class, I'm so glad I took this class.

Wonderfully interesting, intensely passionate, and very driven. I highly recommend Jack for any class you can possibly get with him, very approachable. You have to attend almost all of his discussions and write thoughtful papers but he is a kind grader. God help your soul if you fall asleep in his class.
absolutely the best class i have ever taken at uw madison. unfortunately i hear it will not be offered anymore, but if you get him for another class...highly recommend

Easy, easy, easy A. Was recommended this class as a GPA booster and was not disappointed. If you attend all the lectures and discussion sections (3 a week), and don't miss any papers, it's a guaranteed A.  There's even ample extra credit if you decide to skip a few lectures. Take this class if you need a few more 4.0 credits.

I didn't get the greatest grades on all my papers, but I still ended up with an A in the class. He manages to get quite a few really interesting guest speakers which is a nice change of pace. Overall, the class is not the best I've taken in the IES department, but definitely an easy A. No exam, just weekly papers and 2  bigger papers.

You get credit for attendance! The grading system is very fair and you basically will get an A if you do what you need to. Weekly papers get annoying but it definitely beats taking exams. I learned more in this class than my others because I never had to cram random info into my brain. The material is very eye opening and I enjoyed listening to him
Wonderful professor. One of my favorite classes at Madison so far.  He is biased, but portrays his views in a professional way. No tests, just papers. Take this class.

He's passionate & knows what he's talking about. He may be a little biased, but at least, he spent time figuring out his opinions rather than let other people decide for him. There are no tests because he wants you to actually think about what he's teaching, not just memorize it for an exam. He hates people who sleep, so pay attention in class.

I'm happy that I was taught about an interesting topic by someone who KNOWS what he's talking about. His life is just what he teaches and making students find the power to succeed. A lot of his classes were discussion based, but that's what made the class more exciting. Not much work, and it was an enjoyable time in class.

Easiest class in the world. Come to class and you get an automatic C. Then you have to write a one page paper every week. Lots of extra credit. If you don't get an A in the class there is something wrong with you.

Jack is certainly an experience.  But it's refreshing to listen to a professor be passionate about what he preaches.  He gets really excited when he talks.  It's a great course, and he is probably the major reason for that.
It wouldnt be a long shot to call him psycho. With that being said he is always trying to keep students thinking, and he does a good job at that. Great professor, very one sided at times (or always).
Who doesn't want an easy A? You just gotta come to class, listen to this mad man blab for an hour, and agree with him.

Great professor with lots of knowledge. Really changed my thinking out the way society and the environment interact. I recommend this class to everyone! Make sure you agree with him on the papers he grades, that's the only way to get a good score.

Professor Kloppenburg is a madman, and he takes pride in that fact. He presents introductory environmental issues with a clear bias, which he claims is so that we "stay awake" in his class. Which is ok. Easy class to earn points, no exams, the point in to pay attention and open your mind. Prof K is usally successful at this.
I think this is the easiest class to get an A. The prof always give you chances to earn points.

You're either going to love him or hate him, but I love him! This class really opens your eyes to a variety of environmental issues and makes you think from a different perspective. He has a strong opinion and makes it known, so if that bothers you than don't take this class. If you go in with an open mind, you'll probably love it!

Jack is an awesome professor for IES 112! He can make you leave feeling a little upset about the world, but he explains social and environmental issues with clarity. Jack is someone who exposes what most people can't see for themselves. He's engaging, brings in lots of speakers, and has no test. You have to be involved with the material!
Very helpful and passionate about what he teaches.

Great overview of the issues in environment.  If you've had other classes in this subject, you'll know it all already, but you can still learn about great resources.  Lectures can be hard to follow sometimes but there are no exams so you can still enjoy them.  Great informative, easy class overall.

Environmental/social issues are my thing, but if you have already been exposed to these issues in other courses, then Jack's course is useless. Good guy but his style is preachy and condescending, and I didn't get anything new out of the course. Others may get more out of it if it's your first exposure to the material, but don't be put off by Jack.

Honestly, this class will change your life. It did mine. While you could write off this class as easy and mildly entertaining, it is extremely informative about real issues that affect your daily life that you might not of paid the slightest attention to, like the vending machine down the hall. This class will change your life.

Easy A if you show up to lecture and do what's asked of you.  Lots of extra credit available as well.  He comes off as a raving liberal at first, but if you listen closely he's more balanced than it seems and questions many of the ideas that are common in in the env. studies field.  I grew to really look forward to his lectures. Highly recommended!
Jack is very opinionated and shares his opinion with everybody.  Eventually you really get tired of him and just want to get out of there.

This class is great.  I never would have taken it if it weren't required for the IES certificate, but I'm glad I did.  Although the reaction papers get tiresome, I got a lot of good information and was very interested in the subject.  He lets you be very self-directed in your learning.
Easiest class ever. No exams. Interesting. Easy A if you're willing to go to class. (A huge chunk of your grade is attendance).

Awesome. Teaches class very liberally. Many different topics discussed, therefor you can get a good overview of issues in our world today. Severl guest-lecturers that spice up the class.I would totally recommend the class! Had an awesome TA also. You get chances to go outside, get your hands dirty and research something that interests YOU4credit
he's one of the most condescending people i've ever met. his lectures are BORING and the weekly reaction papers are very annoying. however, my TA was amazing

Decent professor.  Many lectures were boring, but the class is important because I learned what environmentalism actually means.  Most people don't know, and therefore, most people should take this class.

To be fair, he isnt the best professor out there.  I mean, he basically just complains in front of the class for 50 min each lecture, requiring you to just listen.  Disc. sections were great though-best part of the class, real interactive.  Overall, his points and messages are good, but the way in which he presents himself is typical liberal nonsen

I hate lectures. They are useless, yet he makes you go. don't be more than 15min late, and never do anything else during class except take notes or he'll embarrass you in front of the entire class. articles and reaction papers get old.the exercise grading is tough, and you can't translate rankings into any sort of grade. I spent hours on mine and g

No exams, although a one-page paper is due every week of the semester (tiresome).  Two "big" papers for the entire semester, which were very easy.  He's somewhat of a toughie on grading papers, but, other than that, he's a good professor.  Class recommended!  Easy A.
His teaching methods are awesome.  All he wants is for you to really think about environmental issues.  Two papers, no exams.  Showing up is 44% of your grade.  Nice guy.

Jack is a good guy, easy to talk to and eager to help students out. His lectures are a bit confusing at times, but the class is very interesting and simple. A good overview of environmental issues. I highly recomend the class.

his lectures are condescending and he always tries to get in the last word at the end of class. i could tell he cared about what he was teaching, but he tried way too hard to make it dramatic. he also got really angry at a 300 person class for people coming late. ridiculous. but still a good prof.
While he is a rant-er, i thought the class was a good introduction to environmental issues and made me think about my actions and how they affect the greater world around me.
No Comments
No Comments
